intro: Hieracium regiomontanum, commonly known as the Mexican hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
